title: Longfellow House Washington's Headquarters National Historic Site: Multimedia Presentations
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Photos & Multimedia     Multimedia Presentations               Multimedia Presentations           Friday Show and Tell is a video series highlighting individual objects at the site - some of which are not normally on display on house tours.  With tens of thousands of objects in our museum collection, it can be difficult to relate all of the fascinating stories each one represents during a 45-minute house tour.  With that in mind, our Show and Tell video series highlights individual objects and shares why each piece is significant to the history of the site.   You can also visit our YouTube page to view these with captions and in high definition.                        Astronomy Guide For April's Show and Tell, we feature an astronomy guide that belonged to Fanny Appleton's sister, Mary.  Duration:2 minutes, 17 seconds                                Bret Harte Books These books, from Henry Longfellow's library, are by one of the poet's we'll be featuring during our April Brown Bag Poetry Lunch series.  Duration:1 minute, 51 seconds                                Tony Vassall Doll This doll is said to represent Anthony (Tony) Vassall, one of the first people to live at the site of what is now Longfellow House-Washington's Headquarters NHS.  Duration:2 minutes, 9 seconds                                Bronze Match Holder Learn about a special match holder that rests on Henry Longfellow's study table.  Duration:1 minute, 42 seconds
